definition: grandpa (polite form of address for old man)

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
father's elder brother/senior/paternal elder uncle/eldest of brothers/respectful form of address/Count, third of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]
father's elder brother/senior/paternal elder uncle/eldest of brothers/respectful form of address/Count, third of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]

sentences.english: You 'd better ask that old man himself.
sentences.chinese: 你最好问问那老伯伯本人。

sentences.english: That old uncle of yours is a queer fish.
sentences.chinese: 你那位老伯伯，可真是个古怪的人。

sentences.english: Look, the old man's kite is a dragon.
sentences.chinese: 看，那位老伯伯的是一只巨龙风筝。

sentences.english: You set a good example for us when you helped the old man cross the street.
sentences.chinese: 你帮助那名老伯伯过马路，为我们树立了好榜样。

definition: (old) grandfather/polite address for an elderly man, or a woman's father-in-law/(Taiwanese) grandfather
(coll.) father's father's mother/paternal great-grandmother/respectful form of address for an old woman
maternal aunt/step-mother/childcare worker/nursemaid/woman of similar age to one's parents (term of address used by child)/CL:個|个[ge4]
(coll.) father's older brother/uncle/term of respect for older man
older man/man of mature years (Japanese loanword)
(informal) grandma (paternal grandmother)/(respectful) mistress of the house/CL:位[wei4]/(coll.) boobies/breasts
